title: The Spiral Reckoning
outcome: Free zone councils exploit Halden’s spiral override, rewriting local scoring rules. BCI scores become tools of favoritism or justice, triggering social upheaval and challenging the legitimacy of any one model for Stenograd.

events.description: Free zone councils realize the spiral override allows local adjustments of scoring logic. Some zones erase blemished records; others reward historic protestors or punish ex-Council loyalists.
Stories spread of individuals whose fortunes change overnight—gaining or losing access to essentials or jobs based solely on new local scoring whims.
Oksana Lintz and Nikola Petrak debate the ethics of continued spiral-based overrides, seeing both creative community healing and dangerous escalation of reprisals.
Citywide public meetings erupt, with neighborhoods arguing over fair scoring, demanding full abolition of BCI, or threatening direct conflict to defend their version of justice.
